thread.title: CAK beats Loudon, clinches playoff spot
thread.title_full: CAK beats Loudon, clinches playoff spot

title: CAK beats Loudon, clinches playoff spot
text:
CAK clinches playoff spot, drops Loudon Jay Malone 11:48 PM, Oct 2, 2015 5 mins ago Copyright 2015 Journal Media Group. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. Show Caption Previous Next 
CAK clinched a berth in the Class 3A football playoffs with a 42-20 victory over visiting Loudon on Friday night. 
The Warriors (7-0, 3-0 Region 2-3A) remained perfect on the season with another superb effort by junior quarterback Cole Smith’s accurate arm. 
Smith picked apart the Loudon secondary in the first half. 
Still, CAK tight end/linebacker Austin Pope said the Warriors were not happy. 
“Honestly it was kind of hard today,” said Pope, a University of Tennessee commitment. “We didn’t have any energy at all coming out.” 
Pope was a key part of the first-half scoring drives. He blocked well and scored on a 45-yard pass from Smith to give CAK a 14-0 lead. 
Loudon broke through with a designed quarterback run by Jacob Crabtree to cut the deficit to 28-6. 
In the third quarter, Loudon (2-4, 0-3) continued its heavy running attack, which was lead by junior Hayden Richardson. 
Trying to catch up, Loudon started going for it on fourth down. 
“We were down three touchdowns and against a great football team,” Loudon coach Joe Campbell said. “At that point, we really didn’t have a choice.” 
CAK began giving its backup players some opportunities toward the end of the game. 
Freshman Kyle Carter picked up the last CAK touchdown with 7:33 to go in the fourth. 
After a blocked punt by Austin Jewell, the Redskins scored two late touchdowns. 
“We’re just going to build off of that and bring forward the positives out of this ball game,” Campbell said. Jay Malone is a freelance contributor. 
CAK 42, Loudon 20 
Loudon 0 6 0 14 — 20 
CAK 7 21 7 7 — 42 
Scoring: C—Phillip Nichols 44 pass from Cole Smith (Isaac Gallegos kick); C—Austin Pope 45 pass from Smith (Gallegos kick); C—Smith 19 run (Gallegos kick); C—Nichols 4 pass from Smith (Gallegos kick); L—Jacob Crabtree 12 run (kick failed); C—Cole Welch 1 run (Gallegos kick); C—Kyle Carter 4 run (Gallegos kick); L—Logan McDonald 23 pass from Crabtree (McDonald kick); L—Tim Wilson 50 pass from Layne Parks (Tyler Wombles kick) 
Records: Loudon 2-4, 0-3 Region 2-3A; CAK 7-0, 3-0 Copyright 2015 Journal Media Group. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.
